<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="5E8DB7063D4F41A9A4D2BA3BCA198DD1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 108PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In July 2015, GSE entered into a separation and release agreement with James Eberle, the former CEO of the Company.&#160; Effective July 31, 2015, Mr. Eberle resigned his position as CEO and as a director on GSE's board of directors.&#160; The Company incurred a $380,000 charge in the third quarter 2015 in severance expense related to the termination of Mr. Eberle.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="62F8CD5E37FF4ED594FBD608834252F7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 108PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the third quarter 2015, the Board of Directors of the Company approved restructuring actions for the Company's worldwide operations.&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company incurred $1.4 million of restructuring charges including severance expense, facility closing costs, and other restructuring costs.&#160; The restructuring actions were designed to deliver cost reductions and operating efficiencies throughout the Company and reduce both operations overheads and selling, general, and administrative expenses.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="BC732DC010264219B1018705278E18C8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	During the year ended December 31, 2014, the Company incurred restructuring costs of $611,000 associated with the downsizing of our Swedish operations.&#160; We also incurred severance costs of $653,000 for our U.S. operations for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Depreciation.
</FONT>
	&#160; Depreciation expense totaled $493,000 and $545,000 for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Amortization of definite-lived intangible assets.
</FONT>
	&#160; Amortization expense related to definite-lived intangible assets totaled $494,000 and $193,000 for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In conjunction with the Hyperspring acquisition on November&#160;14,&#160;2014, we recorded $779,000 of customer-related intangible assets which are being amortized on a waterfall basis over seven&#160;years.&#160; We recognized $365,000 and $50,000 of amortization expense for the Hyperspring intangible assets for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The balance of the intangible asset amortization expense for&#160;2015 and 2014 relates to the intangible assets arising from the prior year acquisitions of EnVision Systems, Inc. and TAS Holdings Ltd.&#160; Amortization is recognized on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful life of the intangible assets, except for contractual customer relationships and contract backlog which are recognized in proportion to the related projected revenue streams.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating loss.
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company had an operating loss of $4.1&#160;million (-7.3% of revenue) for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015, as compared with an operating loss of $7.5&#160;million (-20.0% of revenue) for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014.&#160; The variances were due to the factors outlined above.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest income, net.
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company's interest income, net totaled $88,000 and $143,000 for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company has a $7.5&#160;million revolving line of credit with BB&amp;T&#160;Bank (formerly Susquehanna Bank).&#160; The credit facility was established mainly to collateralize letters of credit which are issued as advance payment, bid or performance bonds.&#160; The line of credit, which is in the principal amount of up to $7.5&#160;million, bears interest at a rate equal to the Wall Street Journal Prime Rate of Interest, floating with a floor of 4 &#189;%.&#160; The agreement expires on June 30, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In 2014, the credit agreement was amended to require that all outstanding letters of credit be cash collateralized in segregated, restricted accounts.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, the Company had approximately $3.5&#160;million and $4.2&#160;million, respectively, of cash in escrow accounts with BB&amp;T that were being used as collateral for various advance payment and performance bonds.&#160; The Company recorded interest income of $10,000 and $7,000 from the escrow accounts for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160; The interest earned on these restricted funds is added to the restricted cash balance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November&#160;14,&#160;2014, the acquisition date, Hyperspring had a $1.0&#160;million working capital line of credit with IberiaBank.&#160; Interest was payable monthly at a rate of the prime rate of interest as published in the money rate section of the Wall Street Journal plus 2.50%. The effective rate at November&#160;14,&#160;2014 was 5.750%. The line was secured by all accounts and was guaranteed by the members of Hyperspring.&#160; The Company recorded interest expense of $3,000 from the line of credit for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December&#160;7,&#160;2014, the working capital&#160;line of credit matured while the Company was renegotiating the new terms with IberiaBank subsequent to&#160;the acquisition of Hyperspring.&#160;&#160;On January&#160;22,&#160;2015, a promissory note was executed between Hyperspring and IberiaBank to extend the $1.0&#160;million line of credit until&#160; July 6, 2016. Under the new terms, interest is payable monthly at the rate of 1.00 percentage points over the prime rate of interest as published in the money rate section of the Wall Street Journal. The effective rate at the date of the promissory note was 4.25%. The line is secured by all accounts of Hyperspring and guaranteed by GSE Systems, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company had $5.4&#160;million and $7.5&#160;million deposited in unrestricted money market accounts&#160; on December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160; Interest income earned on the money market accounts totaled $22,000 and $37,000 for the years ended 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest income on deposits held by the Company's foreign subsidiaries decreased from $102,000 for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014 to $59,000 for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015.&#160; The decrease was primarily attributable to the lower cash balances maintained by the subsidiaries during 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	38
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Gain (loss) on derivative instruments, net.
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company periodically enters into forward foreign exchange contracts to manage market risks associated with the fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates on foreign-denominated trade receivables.&#160; As of December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company had foreign exchange contracts outstanding of approximately 2.1&#160;million Euro, 1.3 million Canadian Dollars 0.5&#160;million Pounds&#160;Sterling, and 0.4&#160;million Australian&#160;Dollars at fixed rates.&#160; The contracts expire on various dates through January 2017.&#160; The Company had not designated the contracts as hedges and has recognized a loss on the change in the estimated fair value of the contracts of $6,000 for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31,&#160;2014, the Company had foreign exchange contracts outstanding of approximately 1.4&#160;million Euro, 0.8 million Australian Dollars, 0.5 million Malaysian Ringgits, and 0.3&#160;million Pounds&#160;Sterling at fixed rates. The contracts expire on various dates through November&#160;2016.&#160; The Company had not designated the contracts as hedges and had recognized a gain on the change in the estimated fair value of the contracts of $365,000 for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The estimated net fair values of the contracts at December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014 was a net asset of $64,000 and $68,000, respectively.&#160; The amounts were recorded on the consolidated balance sheets as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The foreign currency denominated contract receivables that are related to the outstanding foreign exchange contracts at December&#160;31,&#160;2015 are remeasured at the end of each period into the functional currency using the current exchange rate at the end of the period.&#160; For the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, the Company incurred losses of $34,000 and $156,000, respectively, from the remeasurement of such contract receivables.
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other income (expense), net.
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company recognized $146,000 of other expense, net and $1,000 of other income, net for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="4C8D6EF8C3784A729DD8DFC740A680AB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 87.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	o
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	On November&#160;14,&#160;2014, in conjunction with the Hyperspring acquisition, the Company invested $250,000 for a 50% interest in IntelliQlik, LLC ("IntelliQlik").&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized equity losses of $107,000 and $17,000, respectively, on its investment in IntelliQlik.&#160; IntelliQlik is developing a software platform for online learning and learning management for the energy market.&#160; The Company was obligated to contribute an additional $250,000 should IntelliQlik attain certain development milestones by September 30, 2015.&#160; Based on a review of the software platform as of September 30, 2015, GSE concluded that the required development milestones had not been met and did not contribute the additional $250,000 investment.&#160; The Company wrote-off the remaining $126,000 balance of its IntelliQlik investment in the third quarter 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="2F69111DAD8E4687A3CEAF8D4CFEBC63" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	o
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	For the year ended December 31, 2014, the Company recognized losses of $38,000, relating to its pro rata share of operating results from its equity investment in General Simulation engineering RUS Limited Liability Company ("GSE RUS").&#160; The Company's entire investment in GSE-RUS was written off by the end of December 2014, we have not received a request for additional funding from the joint venture and, due to the political issues with Russia regarding the conflict in Ukraine, we do not intend to contribute additional equity in the foreseeable future.
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Provision for Income Taxes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company files tax returns in the United States federal jurisdiction and in several state and foreign jurisdictions. Because of the net operating loss carryforwards, the Company is subject to U.S. federal and state income tax examinations from years 1997 and forward and is subject to foreign tax examinations by tax authorities for years 2008 and forward.&#160; Open tax years related to state and foreign jurisdictions remain subject to examination but are not considered material to our financial position, results of operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's tax expense in 2015 was $471,000 and consisted of $12,000 state income taxes, $110,000 foreign income taxes from the Company's foreign subsidiaries, $18,000 for foreign income tax credits on several non-U.S. contracts, $221,000 of foreign income tax liabilities, and a $146,000 deferred tax liability relating to the tax amortization of goodwill that cannot be offset by deferred tax assets because the anticipated reversal of the deferred tax liability is outside of the anticipated reversal of the deferred tax assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's tax expense in 2014 was $166,000 and consisted of $10,000 state income taxes, $1,000 foreign income taxes from the Company's foreign subsidiaries, $55,000 for foreign income tax withholding on several non-U.S. contracts, $76,000 of foreign income tax liabilities, and $24,000 deferred tax liability relating to the tax amortization of goodwill that cannot be offset by deferred tax assets because the anticipated reversal of the deferred tax liability is outside of the anticipated reversal of the deferred tax assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	An uncertain tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return is recognized in the&#160; consolidated financial statements when it is more likely than not (i.e., a likelihood of more than fifty percent) that the position would be sustained upon examination by tax authorities that have full knowledge of all relevant information. A recognized tax position is then measured at the largest amount of benefit that is greater than fifty percent likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement. Interest and penalties related to income taxes are accounted for as income tax expense.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During 2015 and 2014 the Company recorded $130,000 and $23,000 respectively, of tax liabilities for certain foreign tax contingencies.&#160; In 2014 the Company accrued $2,000 of interest and penalties related to its domestic uncertain tax positions.&#160; These uncertain positions expired in 2015.&#160; In 2014 the Company accrued no interest and penalties related to its foreign uncertain tax positions; $167,000 was accrued in 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has a full valuation allowance on its U.S., Swedish, and Chinese net deferred tax assets at December&#160;31,&#160;2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	41
</DIV>

	Liquidity and Capital Resources.

<DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash provided by operating activities.
</FONT>
	&#160; For the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015, net cash provided by operating activities totaled $1.0&#160;million.&#160; Significant changes in the Company's assets and liabilities for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 included:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="583DDDFAE43B4B279F66ADDBED9405B2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	A $2.5&#160;million decrease in the Company's contracts receivable.&#160; The Company's trade receivables, net of the allowance for doubtful accounts, decreased from $10.8&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2014 to $9.7&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2015.&#160; Through February&#160;29,&#160;2016, the Company collected 73% of the gross trade receivables outstanding as of December&#160;31,&#160;2015.&#160; The Company's unbilled receivables decreased by $1.7&#160;million to $3.3&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2015.&#160; The decrease in the unbilled receivables is due to the timing of contracted billing milestones of the Company's current projects.&#160; In January and February&#160;2016, th
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	e Company invoiced
</FONT>
	$1.7&#160;million of the unbilled amounts; the balance of the unbilled amounts is expected to be invoiced within one year.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2015, trade receivables outstanding for more than 90 days totaled $0.7&#160;million compared to $0.4&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2014.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<BR>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014, net cash provided by operating activities totaled $6.6&#160;million.&#160; Significant changes in the Company's assets and liabilities for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014 included:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="DD01759A273E4386831B593EB3D0636E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#168;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	A $10.3 million decrease in the Company's contracts receivable.&#160; The Company's trade receivables, net of the allowance for doubtful accounts, decreased from $19.0&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2013 to $10.8&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2014.&#160; The Company's unbilled receivables decreased by $0.5&#160;million to $5.1&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2014.&#160; The decrease in the unbilled receivables was due to the timing of contracted billing milestones of the Company's current projects.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2014, trade receivables outstanding for more than 90 days totaled $0.4&#160;million compared to $0.6&#160;million at December&#160;31,&#160;2013.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="321408C917504CDE8C149C63BB706132" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#168;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	A $2.4&#160;million decrease in prepaid expenses and other assets.&#160; In 2013, the Company agreed to sell its 49% stake in GSE-UNIS&#160;Simulation&#160;Engineering&#160;Co.,&#160;Ltd to its partner, Beijing&#160;Unis&#160;Venture&#160;Capital&#160;Co.,&#160;Ltd. for $1.2&#160;million and terminate the joint venture agreement as of July&#160;31,&#160;2013.&#160; We received the $1.2&#160;million in December&#160;2014.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2013, the Company had a $0.4&#160;million receivable for Value Added Tax refund related to our Slovakia project which was collected in 2014.&#160; Our Swedish subsidiary applied $0.3&#160;million of prepayments to pay the Swedish Tax Agency.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="C96C08CA4AD548DA881BAD260EC34BA2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	A $2.1&#160;million decrease in accounts payable, accrued compensation and accrued expenses.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2013 the Company had a $1.1&#160;million accounts payable due to Siemens in conjunction with its Slovak project; the payment was made in 2014.&#160; The Company's December&#160;31,&#160;2014 subcontractor accrual decreased $372,000 due to the progression of work on several projects utilizing subcontractor labor and the related timing of the billing milestones on those contracts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="9B7DCF409FDF40A2A2C54DDED7623EAC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash Used in Investing Activities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160; For the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015, net cash used in investing activities was $1.2&#160;million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company
</FONT>
	made capital expenditures of $277,000 and capitalized software development costs of $1.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; The net amount of cash released as collateral for standby letters of credit, bank guarantees and foreign currency contracts was $654,000 for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2014, net cash used in investing activities was $7.3 million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company
</FONT>
	made capital expenditures of $398,000 and capitalized software development costs of $646,000 for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014.&#160; The net amount of cash restricted as collateral for standby letters of credit, bank guarantees and foreign currency contracts was $3.1 million for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Effective November&#160;14,&#160;2014, GSE&#160;Power&#160;Systems&#160;Inc., completed the acquisition of Hyperspring.&#160; At closing, we paid the Sellers an aggregate of $3.0&#160;million in cash.&#160; According to the Purchase Agreement, a $1.2 million payment was due to the former Hyperspring members if Hyperspring were successful in renewing its contract with the Tennessee Valley Authority ("TVA") for a two year period for substantially the same scope as was currently being provided and with substantially the same economics.&#160; On September 24, 2015, TVA executed a three-year renewal contract with Hyperspring; accordingly the Company paid the $1.2 million payment to the former Hyperspring members in October 2015.&#160; Based upon the EBITDA ("Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization") attained by Hyperspring for the twelve months ended November 13, 2015, the Company was required to pay the Sellers an additional $1.4 million which was paid in January 2016.&#160; In addition, the Company may be required, pursuant to the terms of the Purchase Agreement, to pay the Sellers up to an additional $4.8 million if Hyperspring attains certain EBITDA targets for the two-year period ending November 13, 2017.&#160; Accordingly, the total cash paid to the Hyperspring members may total $10.4 million.&#160; The estimated fair value of the purchase price recorded by the Company totaled $7.0&#160;million.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In connection with the Hyperspring acquisition, the Company also invested $250,000 in IntelliQlik, LLC in exchange for a 50% interest in IntelliQlik pursuant to the terms of the Operating Agreement dated as of November&#160;14,&#160;2014.&#160; The other 50% of IntelliQlik is owned by one of the members of Hyperspring.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash Used in Financing Activities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160; For the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015, net cash used in financing activities totaled $2.0&#160;million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company made payments of $500,000 and $1.2 million to the former owners of EnVision and Hyperspring, respectively, in accordance with the governing purchase agreements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hyperspring has a $1.0 million working capital line of credit with IberiaBank.&#160; The Company paid down $339,000 of the outstanding balance of the line of credit during the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015, and made no new borrowings against the line of credit in 2015
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2014, net cash used in financing activities totaled $910,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company paid down $410,000 of the outstanding balance of the $1.0 million line of credit with IberiaBank in the six weeks between the acquisition date of November&#160;14,&#160;2014 and December&#160;31,&#160;2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014, the Company made payments totaling $500,000 to the former shareholders of EnVision in accordance with the purchase agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Credit Facilities
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Branch Banking and Trust Bank ("BB&amp;T")
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company had a Master Loan and Security Agreement and Revolving Credit Note with BB&amp;T Bank.&#160; The Company's former bank, Susquehanna Bank, was acquired by BB&amp;T Bank effective November&#160;8,&#160;2015.&#160; The Company and its subsidiary, GSE&#160;Performance&#160;Solutions,&#160;Inc. are jointly and severally liable as co-borrowers.&#160; The Loan Agreement provides a $7.5&#160;million revolving line of credit for the purpose of (i) issuing stand-by letters of credit and (ii) providing working capital. Working capital advances bear interest at a rate equal to the Wall Street Journal Prime Rate of Interest, floating with a floor of 4 &#189;%.&#160; The agreement expires on June 30, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As collateral for the Company's obligations, the Company granted a first lien and security interest in all of the assets of the Company, including but not limited to, accounts receivable, proceeds and products, intangibles, trademarks, patents, intellectual property, machinery and equipment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On September 9, 2014, the Company signed a Third Comprehensive Amendment to the Master Loan and Security Agreement.&#160; According to the Third&#160;Amendment, the Company is to maintain a segregated cash collateral account at Susquehanna&#160;Bank (now BB&amp;T Bank) equal to the greater of (i) $3.0&#160;million or (ii) the aggregate principal amounts of all Loans outstanding under the Revolving Credit Facility (including any issued and outstanding letters of credit, working capital advances, and negative foreign exchange positions) as security for the Company's obligations.&#160; Under this Amendment, BB&amp;T Bank shall have complete and unconditional control over the cash collateral account.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On September&#160;30,&#160;2014, Susquehanna Bank collateralized the outstanding letters of credit issued under the line of credit.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2015, total restricted cash on the balance sheet was $3.6 million which included $3.5 held in the cash collateral account.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The credit agreements contain certain restrictive covenants regarding future acquisitions and incurrence of debt.&#160; On July 31, 2015, the Company signed a Fifth Comprehensive Amendment to the Master Loan and Security Agreement in which the Company's financial covenants were reduced from four to two, and the covenant targets were adjusted.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	IberiaBank
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November&#160;14,&#160;2014, the acquisition date, Hyperspring had a $1.0&#160;million working capital line of credit with IberiaBank.&#160; Hyperspring used the IberiaBank line of credit as needed mainly to provide for payroll funding.&#160; The line was replenished through collection of receivables obtained in the following weeks.&#160; Interest was payable monthly at a rate of the prime rate of interest as published in the money rate section of the Wall Street Journal plus 2.50%. The effective rate at November 14, 2014 was 5.750%. The line was secured by all accounts and was guaranteed by the members of Hyperspring.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December&#160;7,&#160;2014, the working capital&#160;line of credit matured while the Company was renegotiating the new terms with IberiaBank subsequent to&#160;the acquisition of Hyperspring.&#160;&#160;On January&#160;22,&#160;2015, a promissory note was executed between Hyperspring and IberiaBank to extend the $1.0&#160;million line of credit.&#160; Under the new terms, interest is payable monthly at the rate of 1.00 percentage points over the prime rate of interest as published in the money rate section of the Wall&#160;Street&#160;Journal. The effective rate at the date of the promissory note was 4.25%. The line is secured by all accounts of Hyperspring and guaranteed by GSE Systems, Inc.&#160; The maturity date of the line of credit is July 6, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December 31, 2014 the outstanding balance on the line of credit was $339,000.&#160; The outstanding balance on the line of credit was repaid in 2015 and no additional borrowings have been made against the line of credit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_13"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contractual Commitments
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company was contingently liable for twelve standby letters of credit and one surety bond totaling $3.6&#160;million which represented advance payment and performance bonds on twelve&#160;contracts.&#160; The Company has deposited the full value of twelve&#160;standby letters of credit, $3.5&#160;million, into money market escrow accounts which have been restricted in that the Company does not have access to these funds until the related letters of credit have expired. The cash has been recorded on the Company's consolidated balance sheets at December&#160;31,&#160;2015 as restricted cash and long-term restricted cash depending on the expiration date of the underlying letters of credit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December&#160;31,&#160;2014, the Company was contingently liable for twelve standby letters of credit and one surety bond totaling $4.2&#160;million which represented advance payment and performance bonds on eleven contracts. The Company had deposited the full value of eleven standby letters of credit, $4.2&#160;million, into money market escrow accounts which had been restricted in that the Company did not have access to these funds until the related letters of credit have expired. The cash was recorded on the Company's consolidated balance sheets at December&#160;31,&#160;2014 as restricted cash and long-term restricted cash depending on the expiration date of the underlying letters of credit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	45
</DIV>

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015 Liquidity Outlook
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company had cash and cash equivalents of $11.1&#160;million and $3.5&#160;million of restricted cash.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has a Master Loan and Security Agreement and Revolving Credit Note with BB&amp;T Bank.&#160; The Company's former bank, Susquehanna Bank, was acquired by BB&amp;T Bank effective November 8, 2015.&#160; The Loan Agreement provides a $7.5&#160;million revolving line of credit for the purpose of (i) issuing stand-by letters of credit and (ii) providing working capital.&#160; Working capital advances bear interest at a rate equal to the Wall Street Journal Prime Rate of Interest, floating with a floor of 4 &#189;%.&#160; The two year agreement expires on June 30, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Under the Agreement, the Company is to maintain a segregated cash collateral account at Susquehanna Bank (now BB&amp;T Bank) equal to the greater of (i) $3.0&#160;million or (ii) the aggregate principal amounts of all Loans outstanding under the Revolving Credit Facility (including any issued and outstanding letters of credit, working capital advances, and negative foreign exchange positions) as security for the Company's obligations.&#160; Under this Amendment, BB&amp;T Bank shall have complete and unconditional control over the cash collateral account.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2015 we were required to maintain cash balances of $3.5&#160;million at BB&amp;T Bank in segregated cash collateral accounts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has a $1.0&#160;million working capital line of credit with IberiaBank.&#160; We draw on this line of credit as needed mainly to provide for Hyperspring's payroll funding. The line is replenished through collection of receivables obtained in the following weeks.&#160; On January&#160;22,&#160;2015, a promissory note was executed between Hyperspring, LLC and IberiaBank to extend the $1.0 million line of credit.&#160; Under the new terms, interest is payable monthly at the rate of 1.00 percentage points over the prime rate of interest as published in the money rate section of the Wall Street Journal. The effective rate at the date of the promissory note was 4.25%. The line is secured by all accounts of Hyperspring and guaranteed by GSE Systems, Inc.&#160; The maturity date of the line of credit is July 6, 2016.&#160; At December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company did not have any outstanding balance on its line of credit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the third quarter 2015, the Board of Directors approved restructuring actions for the Company's worldwide operations.&#160; Thirty-six employees were terminated at the end of September, and we closed our offices in Cary NC, Madison NJ, and Tarrytown NY.&#160; Subsequent to these restructuring actions, the Company has hired several executive staff, including an Interim Chief Operating Officer, a new Senior VP, General Counsel and Risk Management Officer, a Senior VP of Sales, and a Chief Technology Officer.&#160; We believe that the net benefit of these actions will save the Company approximately $3.9 million of cash on an annual basis.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has entered into 2016 with $47.9&#160;million of backlog; $30.2
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;million
</FONT>
	of which is expected to convert to revenue in 2016.&#160; The Company anticipates that its normal operations will generate all of the funds necessary to fund its consolidated operations during the next twelve months.&#160; The Company believes that it will have sufficient liquidity and working capital without additional financing.&#160; Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company may be required to look for additional capital to fund its operations if the Company is unable to operate profitably and generate sufficient cash from operations.&#160; There can be no assurance that the Company would be successful in raising such additional funds if needed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	46
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage47"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Foreign Exchange.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A portion of the Company's international sales revenue has been and may be received in a currency other than the currency in which the expenses relating to such revenue are paid.&#160; Accordingly, the Company periodically enters into forward foreign exchange contracts to manage the market risks associated with the fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Off-balance Sheet Obligations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has no off-balance sheet obligations as of December&#160;31,&#160;2015, except for its operating lease commitments and outstanding letters of credit and surety bonds.&#160; See Contractual Cash Commitments above.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Other Matters.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Management believes inflation has not had a material impact on the Company's operations.
</DIV>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>

<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="90186A6B30B545AFADB00411E0E58B89" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 108PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM7A">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 7A.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK.
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's market risk is principally confined to changes in foreign currency exchange rates. During the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015, 15% of the Company's revenue was from contracts which required payments in a currency other than U.S. Dollars, principally British&#160;Pounds&#160;Sterling&#160;(8.1%),&#160; Chinese&#160;Renminbi&#160;(3.4%), Euros&#160;(1.4%), Australian Dollars (0.7%), Japanese&#160;Yen&#160;(0.3%), Canadian&#160;Dollars&#160;(0.2%) and Swedish&#160;Krona&#160;(0.5%).&#160; For the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014, 29% of the Company's revenue was from contracts which required payments in a currency other than U.S. Dollars, principally Euros, Swedish Krona, British Pounds&#160;Sterling, Chinese&#160;Renminbi, Canadian&#160;Dollars and Japanese&#160;Yen.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition, for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015&#160;and 2014, 3% and 9% of the Company's expenses were incurred in Swedish Krona and 6% and 11% of the Company's expenses were incurred in Pounds&#160;Sterling, respectively.&#160; The Company's exposure to foreign exchange rate fluctuations arises in part from inter-company accounts in which costs incurred in one entity are charged to other entities in different foreign jurisdictions.&#160; The Company is also exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations as the financial results of all foreign subsidiaries are translated into U.S. dollars in consolidation.&#160; As exchange rates vary, those results when translated may vary from expectations and adversely impact overall expected profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company utilizes forward foreign currency exchange contracts to manage market risks associated with the fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates. The principal currencies for which such forward exchange contracts are entered into are the Pound Sterling, the Euro and the Japanese Yen.&#160; It is the Company's policy to use such derivative financial instruments to protect against market risk arising in the normal course of business in order to reduce the impact of these exposures. The Company minimizes credit exposure by limiting counterparties to nationally recognized financial institutions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December&#160;31,&#160;2015, the Company had foreign exchange contracts outstanding of approximately 2.1&#160;million Euros, 1.3 million Canadian Dollars, 0.5&#160;million Pounds&#160;Sterling, and 0.4&#160;million Australian&#160;Dollars at fixed rates.&#160; The contracts expire on various dates through January 2017.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31,&#160;2014, the Company had foreign exchange contracts outstanding of approximately&#160; 1.4&#160;million Euros, 0.8 million Australian Dollars, and 0.5 million Malaysian Ringgits, 0.3&#160;million Pounds&#160;Sterling, at fixed rates. The contracts expire on various dates through November 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company had not designated the contracts as hedges and has recorded a loss on the change in the estimated fair value of the contracts of $6,000 for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015.&#160; The estimated fair value of the contracts was recorded as a net asset totaling $64,000 at December&#160;31,&#160;2015.&#160; The Company recognized a gain of $365,000&#160; for the year ended December&#160;31,&#160;2014, on the changes in fair value of its forward currency exchange contracts.&#160; A 10% fluctuation in the foreign currency exchange rates up or down as of December&#160;31,&#160;2015 would have increased/decreased the change in estimated fair value of the contracts by $6,400.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	47
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
</DIV>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_REPORTOFINDEPENDENTREGIST">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Board of Directors and Stockholders
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	GSE Systems, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sykesville, Maryland
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of GSE&#160;Systems,&#160;Inc. as of December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014 and the related consolidated&#160;statements&#160;of&#160;operations and comprehensive&#160;loss, stockholders'&#160;equity, and cash&#160;flows for each of the two years in the period ended December 31, 2015.&#160; These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company's management.&#160; Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).&#160; Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement.&#160; The Company is not required to have, nor were we engaged to perform, an audit of its internal control over financial reporting.&#160; Our audits included consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion.&#160; An audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.&#160; We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of GSE&#160;Systems,&#160;Inc. at December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the two years in the period ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	,
</FONT>
	in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	/s/ BDO&#160;USA,&#160;LLP
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	GSE SYSTEMS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_NOTESTOCONSOLIDATEDFINANC">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	December 31, 2015, and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	1.&#160; Business and Basis of Presentation
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	GSE Systems, Inc. ("GSE Systems", "GSE" or the "Company") improves human performance through a series of technologies and services that systematically helps clients with everything from recruiting and selecting the right person for the job to training that individual throughout their career from entry-level to expert.&#160; The Company improves plant performance with a combination of engineering, simulation and plant services that help clients get their plants producing revenue faster, running them safely and responsibly decommissioning them.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	2.&#160; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Principles of consolidation
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly-owned subsidiaries. All intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated.&#160; Investments in partnerships, joint ventures, and less-than-majority owned subsidiaries in which the Company has significant influence are accounted for under the equity method.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revisions
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Historically, the Company recognized revenue on multiple element arrangements which included sales of its EnVision software product as delivery occurred on each element except post contract support ("PCS").&#160; PCS revenue was recognized ratably over the PCS term.&#160; During the fourth quarter of 2015, management determined that that Company had not established vendor specific objective evidence ("VSOE") of the fair value for any of the elements in multiple element transactions including sales of its EnVision software licenses.&#160; Accordingly, the consolidated financial statements have been revised to recognize all revenue on multiple element transactions including EnVision software license sales ratably over the PCS terms on these transactions since VSOE did not exist for any of the non-software elements in these multiple element transactions.&#160; The revision to revenue resulted in a decrease to revenue and an increase in operating loss of $587,000 for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160; The revision also had the effect of increasing billings in excess by $1.2 million, decreasing unbilled receivables by $62,000, increasing prepaid expenses and other current assets by $291,000 and increasing the accumulated deficit by $415,000 at December 31, 2014as a result of the cumulative adjustment for prior periods.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Certain prior year amounts have also been revised in the consolidated statements of cash flows to reflect the corrections to Net loss and changes in billings in excess, prepaid expenses and other assets.&#160; The revision had no impact on cash provided by operations or the net decrease in cash and cash equivalents.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company assessed the materiality of these misstatements on prior periods' consolidated financial statements in accordance with SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin ("SAB") No. 99,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Materiality
</FONT>
	, codified in Accounting Standards Codification 250 ("ASC 250"),
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Accounting Changes and Error Corrections
</FONT>
	, and concluded that these misstatements were not material to any prior annual or interim periods.&#160; Accordingly, in accordance with ASC 250 (SAB No. 108,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Considering the Effects of Prior Year Misstatements when Quantifying Misstatements in Current Year Financial Statements
</FONT>
	), the consolidated financial statements as of December 31, 2014, which are presented herein, have been revised.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	F-7
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
</DIV>

</DIV>

</EFX_CASH_FLOW>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Accounting estimates
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The preparation of the consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period.&#160; On an ongoing basis, the Company evaluates the estimates used, including but not limited to those related to revenue recognition, the allowance for doubtful accounts, estimates of future warranty costs, impairments of goodwill and other intangible assets and contingent consideration to be paid in business acquisitions, valuation of stock based compensation awards, and income taxes.&#160; Actual results could differ from these estimates.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	F-10
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue recognition
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company recognizes revenue through (1) fixed price contracts on the sale of uniquely designed/customized systems containing hardware, software and other materials which apply only to the Performance Improvement Solutions segment as well as (2) time and material contracts primarily through Nuclear Industry Training and Consulting support and service agreements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In accordance with ASC 605-35
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Construction-Type and Production-Type Contracts
</FONT>
	("ASC 605"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	)
</FONT>
	, the Performance Improvement Solutions segment accounts for revenue under fixed-price contracts using the percentage-of-completion method.&#160; This methodology recognizes revenue and earnings as work progresses on the contract and is based on an estimate of the revenue and earnings earned to date, less amounts recognized in prior periods.&#160; The Company bases its estimate of the degree of completion of the contract by reviewing the relationship of costs incurred to date to the expected total costs that will be incurred on the project.&#160; Estimated contract earnings are reviewed and revised periodically as the work progresses, and the cumulative effect of any change in estimate is recognized in the period in which the change is identified.&#160; Estimated losses are charged against earnings in the period such losses are identified.&#160; The Company recognizes revenue arising from contract claims either as income or as an offset against a potential loss only when the amount of the claim can be estimated reliably and realization is probable and there is a legal basis of the claim.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Uncertainties inherent in the performance of contracts include labor availability and productivity, material costs, change order scope and pricing, software modification and customer acceptance issues.&#160; The reliability of these cost estimates is critical to the Company's revenue recognition as a significant change in the estimates can cause the Company's revenue and related margins to change significantly from the amounts estimated in the early stages of the project.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As the Company recognizes revenue under the percentage-of-completion method, it provides an accrual for estimated future warranty costs based on historical and projected claims experience.&#160; The Company's long-term contracts generally provide for a one-year warranty on parts, labor and any bug fixes as it relates to customized software embedded in the systems.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's system design contracts do not normally provide for "post contract support" ("PCS") in terms of software upgrades, software enhancements or telephone support.&#160; In order to obtain PCS, the customers must normally purchase a separate contract.&#160; Such PCS arrangements are generally for a one-year period renewable annually and include customer support, unspecified software upgrades, and maintenance releases.&#160; The Company recognizes revenue from these contracts ratably over the life of the agreements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue from the sale of software licenses without other elements in the contract and which do not require significant modifications or customization for the Company's modeling tools are recognized when the license agreement is signed, the license fee is fixed and determinable, delivery has occurred, and collection is considered probable.&#160; We utilize written contracts as a means to establish the terms and conditions by which products support and services are sold to customers.&#160; Delivery is considered to have occurred when title and risk of loss have been transferred to the customer, which generally occurs after a license key has been delivered electronically to the customer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company also recognizes revenue from the sale of software licenses from contracts with multiple deliverables.&#160; These software license sales are evaluated under ASC 985-605,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Software Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
	.&#160; Contracts with multiple element arrangements typically include, but are not limited to, components such as installation, training, licenses, and PCS listed in the contract.&#160; The Company has not established that vendor specific objective evidence ("VSOE") exists for all elements of its software license sales.&#160; If a PCS element exists in the software license arrangement, revenue is recognized ratably over the PCS service period.&#160; If no PCS element exists in the arrangement, revenue is deferred until the last undelivered element is delivered.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company recognizes revenue under time and materials contracts primarily from the Nuclear Industry Training and Consulting segment and certain cost-reimbursable contracts.&#160; Revenue on time and material contracts is recognized as services are rendered and performed.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Under a typical time-and-materials billing arrangement, customers are billed on a regularly scheduled basis, such as biweekly or monthly.&#160; Any unbilled amounts are typically billed the following month.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Under cost-reimbursable contracts, which are subject to a contract ceiling amount, we are reimbursed for allowable costs and paid a fee, which may be fixed or performance based.&#160; However, if costs exceed the contract ceiling or are not allowable under the provisions of the contract or applicable regulations, we may not be able to obtain reimbursement for all such costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	F-11
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash and cash equivalents
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash and cash equivalents represent cash and highly liquid investments including money market accounts with maturities of three months or less at the date of purchase.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Restricted cash
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Restricted cash consists of the cash collateralization of outstanding letters of credit used for various advance payment, bid, surety and performance bonds, and negative foreign exchange positions which have been segregated into restricted money market accounts with BB&amp;T Bank.&#160; BB&amp;T Bank has complete and unconditional control over the restricted money market accounts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, the Company had approximately $3.5&#160;million and $4.2&#160;million, respectively, of cash in escrow accounts with BB&amp;T Bank.&#160; The restricted cash balance has been classified within the consolidated balance sheets as follows: $1.8 million of current assets and $1.8&#160;million of long term assets at December&#160;31,&#160;2015, respectively, compared to $613,000 of current assets and $3.6&#160;million of long-term assets at December&#160;31,&#160;2014. The Company recorded interest income of $10,000 and $7,000 from the escrow accounts for the years ended December&#160;31,&#160;2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160; The interest earned on these restricted funds is added to the restricted cash balance.&#160; The Company classifies the restriction and release of the cash collateralization of outstanding letters of credit as an investing activity within the consolidated statements of cash flows, as these deposits are not related to borrowings against our line of credit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contract receivables, net
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contract receivables include recoverable costs and accrued profit not billed which represents revenue recognized in excess of amounts billed.&#160; Billings in excess of costs and estimated earnings on uncompleted contracts in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets represent advanced billings to clients on contracts in advance of work performed.&#160; Generally, such amounts will be earned and recognized over the next twelve months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Billed receivables are recorded at invoiced amounts.&#160; The allowance for doubtful accounts is based on historical trends of past due accounts, write-offs, and specific identification and review of customer accounts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The activity in the allowance for doubtful accounts is as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: -7.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</DIV>

	&#160;

<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="2" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

	&#160;
</TD>
